image.altText: an area crowded with makeshift tents with palm trees in the perimeter

props.synopsis: A small sense of normalcy has returned in some areas of Gaza, but other parts remain under Israeli military control, fuelling concerns the strip is being divided.

title.children: A tale of two Gazas: Fears 'Yellow Line' could split the strip

image.altText: A dark-haired man in a collared shirt and jeans stands in a shop with racks of jeans behind him.

props.synopsis: A millionaire fashion boss is banned from entering Byron Bay's party precinct as he awaits trial over violent sexual offences.

title.children: Millionaire fashion boss charged with violent sexual offences in Byron Bay

image.altText: Prince Andrew looks unhappy as he is dressed in a dark suit surrounded by a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: A US congressional panel has summoned the former British prince Andrew Mountbatten Windsor for questioning over his ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Former prince Andrew summoned by US politicians over Epstein ties

image.altText: Profile of a man.

props.synopsis: Vice Admiral Jonathan Mead's retirement will come just a year before the first US nuclear-powered submarine is due to be deployed to Western Australia in 2027 under the AUKUS agreement.

title.children: Australia's 'no fail' submarine mission set for shake-up as boss quits

image.altText: A wide shot of suburban housing on a hill.

props.synopsis: The role of migration is one of the most contentious elements to the housing debate. So what does the evidence show?

title.children: These charts show the effect of migration on Australia's housing story

image.altText: The sun rises above a highway. The sky is coloured red and yellow.

props.synopsis: According to the report, the past 11 years, 2015 to 2025 have been the 11 warmest individual years in the 176-year observational record.

title.children: Report shows 'unprecedented' trend of global temperature rising

image.altText: Smoke rising from behind buildings

props.synopsis: The Israeli military carries out air strikes on southern Lebanon after issuing evacuation orders for several locations, saying it targeted weapons storage facilities for Hezbollah.

title.children: UN says Israeli strikes in southern Lebanon violate ceasefire

image.altText: A close-up shot of Sarah Henderson speaking in Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Liberal senator Sarah Henderson says Opposition Leader Sussan Ley is losing support in the Liberal party room. Follow live.

title.children: 'Can't pretend things are good': Liberal senator says Ley losing support in party

Liberal empathises with WA MPs who have to return to Canberra for net zero meeting

image.altText: Marshawn Kneeland looks at the camera

props.synopsis: The NFL is in mourning after the tragic and sudden loss of Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland, who was just 24.

title.children: NFL player Marshawn Kneeland of Dallas Cowboys dies aged 24

image.altText: Julian Walker takes a selfie and smiles.

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence chatbots like ChatGPT are embedded in modern life, with some Australians using them to help work through PTSD and toxic work environments.

title.children: 'Claude never sleeps': The new AI therapists that don’t judge, get tired or need an appointment

image.altText: Waves hit a coastal wall.

props.synopsis: Forecasters warn that Kalmaegi could dump more than 600 millimetres of rain in Vietnam.

title.children: Typhoon Kalmaegi makes landfall in Vietnam after killing 114 in Philippines

image.altText: Elon Musk climbing up stairs to board plane.

props.synopsis: Tesla holds its annual general meeting in Texas, as Elon Musk seeks the highest ever CEO compensation package. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Tesla shareholders vote on Elon Musk's trillion-dollar pay deal

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Wall Street closes, stocks dip again in late trade

Tesla targets small investor to support Musk trillion-dollar deal

image.altText: A carton of imported cigarettes sitting seized in a warehouse

props.synopsis: Authorities stress the $4 billion figure is conservative, as it does not include illegal vapes and e-cigarettes.

title.children: Australia's $4 billion illicit tobacco trade fuels a violent criminal market

image.altText: Nancy Pelosi holding the speaker's gavel.

props.synopsis: Ms Pelosi was the first woman to serve as US Speaker of the House of Representatives, and her decision will bring to an end a political career spanning four decades.

title.children: Nancy Pelosi to retire from Congress, ending long career in US politics

image.altText: A dragonfly with brown and yellow-striped wings perched on a stick.

props.synopsis: What flies like a helicopter and devours mosquitoes? Meet the 2025 ABC Australian Insect of the Year.

title.children: Graphic flutterer dragonfly voted 2025 Insect of the Year

image.altText: Close-up of mouse-like creature with dark black eyes standing on browny red dirt under bush with yellow ball flowers.

props.synopsis: Animals and plants aren't automatically taken off most national and state extinct species list in Australia if they are rediscovered, leaving them without protection as threatened species.

title.children: This tiny native mouse is legally considered both dead and alive

image.altText: Two people holding out their forearms and applying sunscreen on a sunny beach.

props.synopsis: A review by Australia's pharmaceutical regulator has raised concerns about "endocrine disruptors" in some sunscreens. Is there any reason to be worried?

title.children: What is the safest sunscreen you can use?

image.altText: A man stands on the horizon, completely silhouetted by the moon, in sand dunes in Lancelin. January 31, 2018.

props.synopsis: There has been a lot going on in the headlines this week — were you paying attention?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A supermoon, a famous bathroom and last horse over the line at the Melbourne Cup

image.altText: Close up of middle-aged man looking past camera

props.synopsis: The announcement comes six months after the ABC first reported the Northern Territory Racing and Wagering Commission chair had accepted corporate hospitality from bookmakers.

title.children: Gambling regulator stops accepting gifts from betting companies, for now

image.altText: A German police officer with his back turned to the camera, with Polizei written on his vest.

props.synopsis: The Nazi symbol was smeared dozens of times on cars, letter boxes and building facades, with tests confirming they were daubed in human blood.

title.children: German police investigate swastikas drawn in human blood

image.altText: A woman in a white blouse sits outdoors, painting at a table.

props.synopsis: A Victorian parliament probe into the impacts of cults and organised fringe groups hears lived experience testimony from two women who grew up in high-control religious groups.

title.children: Mirriam grew up in the Church of Scientology and now is pushing for change

image.altText: Alex de Minaur and Carlos Alcaraz talk

props.synopsis: Australian hope Alex de Minaur must get past world No.2 Carlos Alcaraz and 24-time grand slam winner Novak Djokovic to progress at the ATP Finals in Turin.

title.children: De Minaur faces mammoth task with tough ATP Finals draw

image.altText: A man point at a house wearing a green

props.synopsis: When three men turned up on Geoff Wilson's doorstep offering to check his roof for damage he took them up on it. But a requirement that the repairs must be done by a builder of their choice put him on alert.

title.children: Retiree’s close call with potential ‘disaster chasers’ prompts warning

image.altText: A giant black smoke plume rising above a suburban skyline, trees and a cargo train

props.synopsis: Louisville Mayor Craig Greenberg has confirmed the death toll has risen to at least 11 and could increase further to 12 or more, with several people still missing.

title.children: UPS plane  death toll rises, authorities say engine fell off before crash

image.altText: Two men in black clothes.

props.synopsis: Police believe two men travelled to Melbourne from NSW to carry out the fatal shooting of 21-year-old Athan Boursinos in July.

title.children: NSW organised crime link to fatal Melbourne shooting

image.altText: bob katter close up portrait

props.synopsis: "There will be a corner of this Parliament House that is forever Bob Katter," the prime minister said this week.

title.children: Katter gets an early Christmas present, while Coalition stalls on net zero

image.altText: Sena, an older woman wearing a headscarf and purple vest, stands looking serious, leaning against a wall.

props.synopsis: Sena Husic left a war-zone in Bosnia 30 years ago for Australia, and went on to suffer debilitating spinal pain because of the language barrier she struggled to overcome. Now she's finally received treatment, but there a calls for translators to bridge the gap.

title.children: Sena needed surgery, but she couldn't understand her doctors

image.altText: A close-up shot of a baby's foot in his mother's hand.

props.synopsis: The ABC can reveal that in July last year, Queensland Health department became aware of "inconsistencies" in records of the newborn blood spot screening program.

title.children: Hundreds of Queensland babies may have missed vital blood screening tests

image.altText: Three men dressed in black walk with a woman in a beige dress on green carpet.

props.synopsis: Prince William has joined Kylie Minogue and Shawn Mendes, along with a swag of world leaders and celebrities, for the annual Earthshot Prize awards in Rio de Janeiro.

title.children: Prince William joins world leaders, celebs for green-carpeted Earthshot Prize awards

image.altText: A man speaking at a lecturn, with a sign on it that reads A New Era for New York City

props.synopsis: The blistering rise of New York City's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has captured global attention. So what's going on and what does his win say about the American political climate?

title.children: Mamdani's triumph in New York is making waves around the world

image.altText: Floral and teddy bear tributes at the scene of a fire.

props.synopsis: Investigators are trying to piece together the cause of a blaze in central Queensland that has left a family devastated and residents in shock.

title.children: Community mourns as man and three young people die in house fire

image.altText: An armed guard walking past the iconic pyramid entrance to the Louvre museum.

props.synopsis: France's highest auditor says the theft of $157 million worth of jewels was a "deafening alarm bell" for the world-renowned Parisian museum.

title.children: Louvre prioritised art over upgrading security, report says

image.altText: A uniformed police officer and Indigenous woman wearing a pattern dress.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory Police Force has released its first anti-racism strategy for staff, following years of headlines about racist attitudes that have dogged the organisation.

title.children: 'We can't fix what we don't face': NT Police unveils anti-racism plan

image.altText: A drone shot of a lake with shacks on the edge.

props.synopsis: Police and volunteer ambulance officers have told a community meeting they struggle to connect with people during emergencies due to poor 4G access in central Tasmania.

title.children: In this town, residents say poor reception is endangering lives
